messages.content: Recent ultrafast spectroscopy experiments have demonstrated that quantum coherence can persist for hundreds of femtoseconds in the light‑ harvesting complexes of plants, implying that quantum effects may contribute to the high efficiency of photosynthetic energy transfer.

Quantum Entanglement in Photosynthesis

Recent ultrafast spectroscopy experiments have demonstrated that quantum coherence can persist for hundreds of femtoseconds in the light‑ harvesting complexes of plants, implying that quantum effects may contribute to the high efficiency of photosynthetic energy transfer. This observation aligns with earlier reports of coherent energy transfer pathways (Green & Lee, 2022). Moreover, speculative claims about entanglement enhancing these processes have been put forward (Doe & Smith, 2025).
